the server HTTP --> a server HTTP
server HTTP log file will --> server HTTP log files will

(the default), --> (the default), then

Change each file to 'files', or add an 'an' before each HTTP. Dealers choice.

nodes.bodyText: Previous edits have instructed you to use the plural, for example, server HTTP access log files will be written, etc.. If the meaning of the sentence refers to one or more log files, then use the plural. If it refers to only one file, then use the singular, for example, the server HTTP access log file will be written.

@@ -79,12 +79,19 @@ includeServerOutInPodLog: true
 # The default is false.
 logHomeOnPV: false
 
-# The in-pod location for domain log, server logs, server out, and node manager log files
-# If not specified, the value is derived from the domainUID as /shared/logs/<domainUID>
+# The in-pod location for domain log, server logs, server out, node manager log, and
+# HTTP access log files. If not specified, the value is derived from the domainUID as
+# /shared/logs/<domainUID>.
 # This parameter is required if 'logHomeOnPV' is true.
 # Otherwise, it is ignored.
 logHome: /shared/logs/domain1
 
+# Set this value to 'false' to have the HTTP access log files written to the directory 
+# configured in the WebLogic domain home.
+# The default is 'true', which means the HTTP access log files will be written to
+# the logHome directory when logHomeOnPV is enabled.

nodes.bodyText:
1 Does this work if web-server stanza exists already in the original config?
2 Or if web-server and web-server-log stanza exists already in the original config?
3 Or if both of the above exist and the file name is set to something else?
In similar situations for other mbean settings, we needed to special case overrides to use a different syntax to handle 1 and 2.  Not sure about 3 off the top my head.   For example, see the override code for logHome ...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -980,6 +988,26 @@ def customizeDefaultFileStore(self, bean):
     self.undent()
     self.writeln("</d:default-file-store>")
 
+  def customizeAccessLog(self, name):
+    # do not customize if LOG_HOME is not set
+    logs_dir = self.env.getDomainLogHome()
+    if logs_dir is None or len(logs_dir) == 0:
+      return
+
+    # customize only if ACCESS_LOG_IN_LOG_HOME is 'true'
+    if self.env.isAccessLogInLogHome():
+      self.writeln("<d:web-server>")
+      self.indent()
+      self.writeln("<d:web-server-log>")
+      self.indent()
+      # combine-mode "replace" works regardless of whether web-server and web-server-log is present or not
+      self.writeln("<d:file-name f:combine-mode=\"replace\">"
+                   + logs_dir + "/" + name + "_access.log</d:file-name>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server-log>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server>")
+

nodes.bodyText: yes to all 3 (surprisingly)

+                   + logs_dir + "/" + name + "_access.log</d:file-name>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server-log>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server>")
+

nodes.bodyText: Tested on both 12.2.1.3 and 12.2.1.4.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -980,6 +988,26 @@ def customizeDefaultFileStore(self, bean):
     self.undent()
     self.writeln("</d:default-file-store>")
 
+  def customizeAccessLog(self, name):
+    # do not customize if LOG_HOME is not set
+    logs_dir = self.env.getDomainLogHome()
+    if logs_dir is None or len(logs_dir) == 0:
+      return
+
+    # customize only if ACCESS_LOG_IN_LOG_HOME is 'true'
+    if self.env.isAccessLogInLogHome():
+      self.writeln("<d:web-server>")
+      self.indent()
+      self.writeln("<d:web-server-log>")
+      self.indent()
+      # combine-mode "replace" works regardless of whether web-server and web-server-log is present or not
+      self.writeln("<d:file-name f:combine-mode=\"replace\">"
+                   + logs_dir + "/" + name + "_access.log</d:file-name>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server-log>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server>")
+
